2 Exclusive Vehicles ? Get behind the wheel of a '67 Camaro, the only American classic in Need for Speed Most Wanted, and a specially-tuned BMW M3 GTR street machine right out of the box in Quick Race modes.

8 Custom Rides ? Eight specially-tuned rides with hand-selected body kits, spoilers, rims, roof scoops, and more are unlocked and available for you to redline in Quick Race modes. Featured cars: Supra, Lotus Elise, Porsche 911 GT2, Mercedes-Benz SL65 AMG, Corvette C6, Mercedes-Benz SL 500, Porsche 911 Carrera S, and Corvette C6.R.

Exclusive Pursuit Challenge ? Hone your cop evasion skills in this intense Pursuit Challenge that features waves of supercharged SUV cops and the most aggressive police tactics.

3 Exclusive Races ? Ignite the streets in three races created specifically for the Black Edition, unlocked and available to drive right from the start.

Exclusive and Unlocked Vinyls ? Personalize your ride faster than everyone else with dozens of unlocked vinyls as well as specifically-created Black Edition-only designs.

Bonus DVD ? Removed as it adds nothing to the game

@L_S_wEr

To mount an .iso file as a virtual drive, you need one of the following programs:

1) Daemon Tools
2) Magicdisc
3) Alcohol 120%

All 3 of those can mount an .ISO file as a virtual drive. This means that the virtual drive will show up to the Operating System as a physical CD/DVD drive, but it is only software instead of a physical drive (hardware). It saves you from having to burn a CD and put it in your drive, so you can just emulate the drive instead. It's a very easy process once you do it one time.

Minimum Specifications:
-> OS..........: Microsoft Windows 2000 or better
-> CPU.........: 1.4 GHz CPU
-> RAM.........: 256 MB RAM
-> GRAPHICS....: 32 MB
-> HARD DRIVE..: 3 Gb Free Space

I'm having a problem installing that nobody else seems to be having.  It's not seeing my DirectX, and stops with a message "Installation cannot continue because this game requires DirectX 9.0c or higher to be installed on your system."  DirectX 9.0c and DirectX 10 are both installed, but it still does this.  Compatibility mode does not change anything.  Please help!

Anyone who's unable to install due to the installer not detecting DirectX, follow these steps:

1.) Copy contents of ALL the discs/ISOs to a regular folder somewhere on your computer. You should have one folder that is basically all the CDs merged together.

2.) Inside the AutoRun folder is a file called "autorun.cfg"; open it in Notepad (or your text editor of choice).

3.) Change the line "DirectXVersion=9.0c" to read "DirectXVersion=0".

4.) Save and close the file.

5.) Back up to the folder that contains all the disc files, and run AutoRun.exe. It should now install properly.
